question_text: Which paranasal sinus is **NOT** affected when there is a lesion in the hiatus semilunaris?
Which location of a suprahyoid neck space lesion will push the parapharyngeal space medially?
Which cranial nerve is **LEAST** likely affected by a lesion in the cavernous sinus?
Which structure connects the epitympanum of the middle ear to the mastoid antrum?
Which canal is **NOT** found in the sphenoid bone?
Obstruction of which structure would cause dilatation of the third and lateral ventricles?
Which structure separates the frontal and temporal lobes?

options.A: Marginal ramus of the cingulate sulcus

question_text: What is the normal amount of serous fluid in the pericardial space?
On Lateral view, the left atrium is in direct contact with what structure?
Peritoneal lesions would **LEAST** affect which portion of the urinary bladder wall?
Which of the following structures is **NOT** part of the urinary bladder trigone?
Contrast extravasation into the space of Retzius is commonly due to which of the following conditions?
Fluid enveloping the adrenal gland will most likely be contained in which of these spaces?
What layer of the small intestinal wall manifests as bowel wall thickening or “thickened folds” in almost all acute small bowel injuries?
Widening of what aperture of the diaphragm results to hiatal hernia?
What plane separates the right from the left lobe of the liver?

options.A: Plane of main right and left portal veins
options.C: Vertical plane through gallbladder fossa and hepatic veins
options.D: Vertical plane through right hepatic vein

question_text: Which part of the rectus sheath is incomplete resulting to hematomas within the rectus sheath escaping into the extraperitoneal pelvis?
Which of the following aponeuroses DOES NOT usually have a congenital defect or points of weakness that predispose to development of external hernias?
Which type of joint articulation is seen in interosseous membranes of the distal tibiofibular and radioulnar joints?
Which supporting structure is of constant length and transmits muscle tension to a mobile part of the body?
Which of the following refers to freely movable joints?
Which ligament of the knee prevents the femur from moving backwards in the tibia?
Premature closure of which of the following sutures will result to Turricephaly?
Grade 1 germinal matrix hemorrhage corresponds to blood present in which of these structures?
Which is true regarding the puborectalis sling?

options.A: It corresponds to a line drawn from the sacrococcygeal junction to the midpublic bone.
options.B: It corresponds to the “M” line of Cremin.
options.C: It is synonymous with the pubococcygeal line.
options.D: It is usually well-developed and functional in high hindgut arrest.

question_text: Congenital Hydrocele results from patency of this structure that permits entry of peritoneal fluid into the scrotal sac?
Which of the following best describes the line of Perkins?

options.A: It is a line drawn medial to the pseudoaectabulum.
options.B: It is a line drawn vertically from the lateral edge of the acetabulum.
options.C: It is a line drawn vertically from the medial edge of the acetabulum.
options.D: It is a line through the midshaft of the femur and extends above the acetabular roofs.

question_text: Posterior displacement of the urinary bladder is a characteristic feature of masses in which of these areas?
What is the maximum normal endometrial thickness for asymptomatic postmenopausal women?
The thin hypoechoic halo in the uterus corresponds to which of these structures?

options.A: Deep basal layer of the endometrium

question_text: What is the first anatomic structure identified within the gestational sac by sonography?
In which uterine position will the uterine fundus simulate the appearance of a fundal fibroid on transabdominal sonography?
In the normal breast, most of the dense tissue is seen in which quadrant?
